subject: Career
title: Nonverbal Communication: The Silent 93%
description: A quick win: understand Nonverbal Communication: The Silent 93%.

hook.text: Albert Mehrabian's research: 55% of communication is body language, 38% tone, and only 7% words.

buildup.text: When your words say 'I'm fine' but your body says otherwise, people believe the body.

discovery.text: Eye contact, posture, gestures, and facial expressions transmit trust, confidence, and engagement.

twist.text: Mehrabian's numbers apply to emotional messages specifically. But the principle holds: nonverbal signals dominate.

climax.text: In video calls, these signals are reduced. Exaggerate slightly: nod more, lean in, use facial reactions.

punchline.text: People hear your words. They believe your body.

quiz.question: What percentage of emotional communication is body language according to Mehrabian?
